ETYMOLOGY: From Middle French contrepartie 'duplicate of a document, something corresponding to another', from contre- 'against' + partie 'part'. Later influenced by 'part'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person or thing that corresponds to or has the same function as another in a different place, system, or organization.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在不同地点、系统或组织中，与另一人或事物具有相同职位、功能或特点的人或物；对应物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The President will meet with his French counterpart to discuss international relations.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 总统将会见他的法国对应官员，讨论国际关系。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A duplicate of a legal document.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The lease agreement was drawn up in two counterparts, one for each party.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 租赁协议一式两份，双方各执一份。
